description.html: In CSS, ::after creates a pseudo-element that is the last child of the selected element. It is often used to add cosmetic content to an element with the content property. It is inline by default.
description.text: In CSS, ::after creates a pseudo-element that is the last child of the selected element. It is often used to add cosmetic content to an element with the content property. It is inline by default.

description.html: The ::backdrop CSS pseudo-element is a box the size of the viewport which is rendered immediately beneath any element being presented in full-screen mode. This includes both elements which have been placed in full-screen mode using the Fullscreen API and <dialog> elements.
description.text: The ::backdrop CSS pseudo-element is a box the size of the viewport which is rendered immediately beneath any element being presented in full-screen mode. This includes both elements which have been placed in full-screen mode using the Fullscreen API and <dialog> elements.

description.html: In CSS, ::before creates a pseudo-element that is the first child of the selected element. It is often used to add cosmetic content to an element with the content property. It is inline by default.
description.text: In CSS, ::before creates a pseudo-element that is the first child of the selected element. It is often used to add cosmetic content to an element with the content property. It is inline by default.

description.html: The ::cue CSS pseudo-element matches WebVTT cues within a selected element. This can be used to style captions and other cues in media with VTT tracks.
description.text: The ::cue CSS pseudo-element matches WebVTT cues within a selected element. This can be used to style captions and other cues in media with VTT tracks.

description.html: The ::cue-region CSS pseudo-element matches WebVTT cues within a selected element. This can be used to style captions and other cues in media with VTT tracks.
description.text: The ::cue-region CSS pseudo-element matches WebVTT cues within a selected element. This can be used to style captions and other cues in media with VTT tracks.

description.html: The ::first-letter CSS pseudo-element applies styles to the first letter of the first line of a block-level element, but only when not preceded by other content (such as images or inline tables).
description.text: The ::first-letter CSS pseudo-element applies styles to the first letter of the first line of a block-level element, but only when not preceded by other content (such as images or inline tables).

description.html: The ::first-line CSS pseudo-element applies styles to the first line of a block-level element. Note that the length of the first line depends on many factors, including the width of the element, the width of the document, and the font size of the text.
description.text: The ::first-line CSS pseudo-element applies styles to the first line of a block-level element. Note that the length of the first line depends on many factors, including the width of the element, the width of the document, and the font size of the text.

description.html: The ::grammar-error CSS pseudo-element represents a text segment which the user agent has flagged as grammatically incorrect.
description.text: The ::grammar-error CSS pseudo-element represents a text segment which the user agent has flagged as grammatically incorrect.

description.html: The ::marker CSS pseudo-element selects the marker box of a list item, which typically contains a bullet or number. It works on any element or pseudo-element set to display: list-item, such as the <li> and <summary> elements.
description.text: The ::marker CSS pseudo-element selects the marker box of a list item, which typically contains a bullet or number. It works on any element or pseudo-element set to display: list-item, such as the <li> and <summary> elements.

description.html: The ::part CSS pseudo-element represents any element within a shadow tree that has a matching part attribute.
description.text: The ::part CSS pseudo-element represents any element within a shadow tree that has a matching part attribute.

description.html: The ::placeholder CSS pseudo-element represents the placeholder text in an <input> or <textarea> element.
description.text: The ::placeholder CSS pseudo-element represents the placeholder text in an <input> or <textarea> element.

description.html: The ::selection CSS pseudo-element applies styles to the part of a document that has been highlighted by the user (such as clicking and dragging the mouse across text).
description.text: The ::selection CSS pseudo-element applies styles to the part of a document that has been highlighted by the user (such as clicking and dragging the mouse across text).

description.html: The ::slotted() CSS pseudo-element represents any element that has been placed into a slot inside an HTML template (see Using templates and slots for more information).
description.text: The ::slotted() CSS pseudo-element represents any element that has been placed into a slot inside an HTML template (see Using templates and slots for more information).

description.html: The ::spelling-error CSS pseudo-element represents a text segment which the user agent has flagged as incorrectly spelled.
description.text: The ::spelling-error CSS pseudo-element represents a text segment which the user agent has flagged as incorrectly spelled.
